trans-unit.source: Represents an element or attribute that specifies a custom <xref href="System.Type"></xref> in a configuration file.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.CustomTypeElement> class represents an attribute or an element that specifies a custom type in a configuration file.

For example, the [\<claimsAuthenticationManager\>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/windows-identity-foundation/claimsauthenticationmanager.md) element that is used to specify the claims identity manager contains `type` attribute that specifies the <xref:System.Type> of the claims authentication manager; `<claimsAuthenticationManager type="MyNamespace.CustomClaimsAuthenticationManager, MyAssembly"/>`.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfigurationElement.ClaimsAuthenticationManager%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property that represents this element as configured under an [\<identityConfiguration\>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/windows-identity-foundation/identityconfiguration.md) element gets and sets an instance of <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.CustomTypeElement>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Configuration.CustomTypeElement"></xref> class.
Gets a value that indicates whether the element has been configured with non-default values.
`true` if the element has been configured with non-default values; otherwise, `false`.
Attempts to resolve the custom type element to an object of the specified <xref href="System.Type"></xref>.
The custom type element to resolve.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> to which to resolve the custom type element.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> represented by the current instance.
The type represented by this instance.
